materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"acvme","text":"Reagents: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6onaq","text":"Acetone","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmsd7","text":"Conductive silver paint (RS 186-3600)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88bgg","text":"Cyanoacrylate glue (Loctite superglue)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15cip","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0osk","text":"Equipment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bm57c","text":"Light box","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hrj5","text":"Test tube ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fu92c","text":"Forceps with rubber ends (push small piece of rig tubing over each prong of forceps to stop snapping carbon fibre)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mno3","text":"Small scissors","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vpk","text":"Scalpel","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47g2","text":"Microscope with 10X objective and graticule eye piece ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ieg3","text":"Puller","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bf38e","text":"Capillary tubes 2.0 OD 1.16 X 100 mm (Harvard Apparatus, CAT# 30-0074)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4ed2","text":"Wire (RS PRO Data Cable, 9 cores (7/0.1 mm), 30 AWG, PVC coated)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akmf8","text":"Glass Slides","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9vga","text":"Blu Tack","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uuc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpcne","text":"For each electrode:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39glo","text":"Capillary tubes ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nrbm","text":"Wire (use 1 core per electrode)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm48g","text":"Conductive silver paint ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dpp7","text":"Cyanoacrylate glue ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aisnr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dn7nu","text":"Making a cutting block:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bsdqe","text":"Stick two capillary tubes to a glass slide, slightly further apart than a capillary tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ueq6","text":"Cut glass slide in half and on one half score a single groove the full width of the slide with a diamond knife and a metal ruler, sufficiently deep to hold a scalpel in place when drawn down it.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8m1k2","text":"Stick this half slide to the first glass slide (see Figure A for clarification).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5riti","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18u35","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkrge","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

parent_collections.title: Brimblecombe, K.R. et al. (2023) Inhibition of striatal dopamine release by the L-type calcium channel inhibitor isradipine, co-varies with risk factors for Parkinson’s.

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5rn","text":"Fill test tube with acetone (flammables cupboard) and add capillary tubes. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2hge9","text":"Stick test tube to light box with Blu Tack.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"uo28","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"crtf8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b68gj","text":"Careful not to spill acetone on light box.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aoj7a","text":"Select a single carbon fibre using rubber tipped forceps.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"632t8","text":"Thread carbon fibre down capillary tube. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qc12","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8p04e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dfhut","text":"Ensure capillary tube is completely filled with acetone. ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3vpbc","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2cm84","text":"Ensure ~ 0.5 cm carbon fibre is exposed at the end of the capillary tube to stop it from falling out of the end of the tube.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fp2jr","text":"Lift the tube out of the acetone and allow acetone to evaporate.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4330q","text":"Place capillary tube into puller.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s3h6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cklp2","text":"Tighten holder “finger-tight” and raise tube for 3 clicks and secure in place “finger tight”.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a7esh","text":"Settings: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jgnh","text":"Magnet: off","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a24eg","text":"Heat: ~6.7 ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m663","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff66a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7r994","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":63,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"ddluk","text":"The higher the heat, the longer/more gradual the seal will be. ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cetn3","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"678sm","text":"Golden Rule: ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ebmu7","text":"Too cold or short seal: easier to see the capillary tube being cut, but it can make it leaky.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":207,"offset":0,"style":"align-justify"}],"key":"a44ja","text":"Too hot or long seal: harder to see the capillary tube being cut, but also fine class seal can break during an experiment suddendly exposing extra carbon fibre, leading to a noisy and unreliable electrode.  ","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ee7gg","text":"Check which end of the tube the carbon is in and carefully remove from puller.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2u5pf","text":"Trim excess exposed fibre with fine scissors to stop waving extended fibre from stressing the glass seal.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1d43g","text":"Carefully place electrode between capillary tubes on cutting block.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5jmmo","text":"Approximately line up seal with cut ridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"745tp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d4lsp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9aaef","text":"If you have problems seeing the seal, breathe on the fibre and its flex point will indicate the approximate point it joins the glass. ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4mve8","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2urbd","text":"Roll the capillary tube, often one side is more clear. ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9lo0q","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"73rht","text":"When looking, start at the fully exposed carbon fibre end and travel towards the capillary tube, your eye finds spotting the increase from a constant easier than a change to a constant (IMO).","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jl5v","text":"Make a cut at ~ 300 µm from seal, by running scalpel down cut ridge, mark this as 0 on the graticule.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2muk8","text":"Move electrode so there is 50-100 µm exposed carbon fibre and run scalpel down cut ridge. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afi5r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ca9uj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":66,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"abjvk","text":"This step takes practice. Don’t be discouraged and take your time!","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"rr2c","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"edngu","text":"The length of exposed carbon fibre is another golden rule. ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4s0m9","text":"The longer the exposed carbon fibre, the more sensitive your electrode will be (bigger surface to detect dopamine), however, there is more area to detect noise too. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ffl1d","text":"A shorter electrode will be less sensitive, but also often quieter. We can amplify the signal from a shorter electrode, however, remember it will also amplify the noise. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5l58h","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7nbnk","text":"Given we record dopamine from ~100 µm sphere, it makes sense to try to sample the most amount of dopamine available, but not over-sample. An electrode length of 50-100 µm will allow an amplification of 3-10 nA/mV, which we have determined to be optimal for our set up.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"beq5l","text":"Carefully remove electrode from cutting block.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"boka1","text":"Cut wire to slightly longer than your capillary tube.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bl9gu","text":"Strip off ~1cm of the plastic coating from each end.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a9v6t","text":"On one end trim exposed wires so only 1 is sticking out.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"batrr","text":"Dip this end in the conductive silver paint and gently thread down the capillary so the paint makes contact with the carbon fibre.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"17dea","text":"Glue exposed end of wire in place by dripping glue down capillary tube, exposed wire can be connected to voltammetry head-stage using croc-clip. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8hma9","text":"Allow to set overnight before use.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Making CFM
